name: DH Tau
scenarioDescription:
The DH Tau Exoplanetary System


Overview

DH Tau is a star with 0.33 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.27 times its radius. It is located 456.61839999999995 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.001 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

DH Tau is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the DH Tau system

DH Tau b

DH Tau b was discovered by the Subaru Telescope observatory using the Imaging method. The mass of DH Tau b is 3496 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, DH Tau b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, DH Tau b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system DH Tau, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Subaru Telescope.
